resources.string: I\'m a paid tutor and independent developer attending the University of Missouri pursuing a dual degree in electrical and computer engineering.
If you have suggestions for future updates please send them to dhansonmu@gmail.com.
The domain of a function is the set of numbers where the function is defined. E.g. y=1/x ; Domain: x belongs to (-infinity,0) U (0,infinity)
The product rule formula is used when you are trying to find the derivative of two functions that are being multiplied.
The quotient rule formula is used when you are trying to find the derivative of two functions that are being divided.
The fraction infinity over infinity is indeterminate, so infinite limits need to be evaluated to keep the answer from being indeterminate. E.g. Divide by the highest power of "x"
The limit definition is used to find the point that x approaches at the number n.
The definition of the derivative is the actual formula used to calculate derivatives, though there are many quicker ways of calculating derivatives.
The power rule is a simple formula to make the process of calculating derivatives much easier.
The chain rule is another formula to simplify the calculation of derivatives.
The formal integral definition formula uses a Riemann sum, which uses an infinite amount of rectangles to find the area under a curve.
The definite integral formula can be used instead of the Riemann sum formula.
